org.jooby

Class Deferred

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jooby.Result
      • org.jooby.Deferred

  • public class Deferred
extends Result

    async request processing

    A Deferred result, useful for async request processing. Application can produces a result from a thread of its choice.

    usage

     {
    ExecutorService executor = ...;

    get("/async", promise(deferred  -> {
      executor.execute(()  -> {
        try {
          deferred.resolve(...); // success value
        } catch (Exception ex) {
          deferred.reject(ex); // error value
        }
      });
    }));
  }

    Or with automatic error handler: 

     {
    ExecutorService executor = ...;

    get("/async", promise(deferred  -> {
      executor.execute(()  -> {
        deferred.resolve(()  -> {
          Object value = ...
          return value;
        }); // success value
      });
    }));
  }

    Or as Runnable with automatic error handler: 

     {
    ExecutorService executor = ...;

    get("/async", promise(deferred  -> {
      executor.execute(deferred.run(()  -> {
        Object value = ...
        return value;
      }); // success value
    }));
  }

    Application can produces a result from a different thread. Once result is ready, a call to set(Object) is required. Please note, a call to set(Object) is required in case of errors.

    error handling

    Due the code will be handle by an external/new thread, you MUST be ready to handle errors, usually with a try/catch statement. A call to set(Object) is required too in case of an error.

    Checkout the utility method resolve(Callable) and/or run(Callable). Both of them catch and handle exceptions for you.

    Since:
    0.10.0
    Author:
    edgar

      • set

        public Result set(Object value)
        resolve(Object) or reject(Throwable) the given value.
        Overrides:
        set in class Result
        Parameters:
        value - Resolved value.
        Returns:
        This content.

      • resolve

        public void resolve(Object value)
        Resolve the deferred value and handle it. This method will send the response to a client and cleanup and close all the resources.
        Parameters:
        value - A value for this deferred.

      • reject

        public void reject(Throwable cause)
        Resolve the deferred with an error and handle it. This method will handle the given exception, send the response to a client and cleanup and close all the resources.
        Parameters:
        cause - A value for this deferred.

      • run

        public <T> Runnable run(Callable<T> block)
        Produces a Runnable that runs the given Callable and resolve(Callable) or reject(Throwable) the deferred. Please note, the given Callable runs in the caller thread.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Resulting type.
        Parameters:
        block - Callable that produces a result.
        Returns:
        This deferred as Runnable.

      • resolve

        public <T> void resolve(Callable<T> block)
        Run the given Callable and resolve(Callable) or reject(Throwable) the deferred. Please note, the given Callable runs in the caller thread.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Resulting type.
        Parameters:
        block - Callable that produces a result.

      • handler

        public void handler(Deferred.Handler handler)
             throws Exception
        Setup a handler for this deferred. Application code should never call this method: INTERNAL USE ONLY.
        Parameters:
        handler - A response handler.
        Throws:
        Exception - If initializer fails to start.
